comment.text: Part of the host defense system of polymorphonuclear leukocytes. It is responsible for microbicidal activity against a wide range of organisms. In the stimulated PMN, MPO catalyzes the production of hypohalous acids, primarily hypochlorous acid in physiologic situations, and other toxic intermediates that greatly enhance PMN microbicidal activity.
Binds 1 heme b (iron(II)-protoporphyrin IX) group covalently per monomer.
Homodimer; disulfide-linked. Each monomer consists of a light and a heavy chain.

disease.name: Myeloperoxidase deficiency
disease.description: A disorder characterized by decreased myeloperoxidase activity in neutrophils and monocytes that results in disseminated candidiasis.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the peroxidase family. XPO subfamily.

property.value: P:negative regulation of growth of symbiont in host
P:respiratory burst involved in defense response

feature.description: In MPOD; affects proteolytic processing and secretion; dbSNP:rs78950939.
In a colorectal cancer sample; somatic mutation; dbSNP:rs762688992.
In MPOD; suppress post-translational processing; dbSNP:rs119468010.
